timeline.message: [Peformance] Several performance fixes during finalizing writes for S3

timeline.bodyText:
i think this is the reason for needing spark in hudi-common.. we can move refactor the code to hudi-client..
In fact, #1755  has already modularized this more..
timeline.author: vinothchandar

timeline.bodyText: @umehrot2 so seems like, for object stores this is different..  and makes sense completely to do parallel cleaning of individual files.
timeline.author: vinothchandar

replies.bodyText:
cc @n3nash should we have flag to protect this for HDFS.. i.e if the recursive delete works better there (IIUC). you might want to tradeoff less RPCs ..?
we can override defaults at spark datasource level, and set these based on StorageSchemes as well.
replies.author: vinothchandar

replies.bodyText: @vinothchandar I don't think there is any different between EmrFS which uses S3 vs HDFS working w.r.t RPC calls made here. EmrFS just implements the HDFS interface, but the internals like RPC calls to the namenode etc. remain the same.
replies.author: umehrot2

timeline.author: vinothchandar

replies.bodyText: Will address in the next revision, one I have more feedback as needed from @n3nash
